newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks close up, hope high for good 1997.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks close up, hope high for good 1997.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed up for a third day in a row, based mainly on anticipation of good times next year, brokers said.
The Colombo Stock Exchange all share index closed 4.6 points up at 597, up for a third day after falling steadily for the past week.
"Everyone is expecting the market to move up in January," said Dihan Dedigama, manager at John Keells Stock Brokers.
"Today's activity may have been in anticipation of that movement," he said.
Turnover, supported by 200,000 shares of Sampath Bank (up 1.75 to 45.75), 448,800 Three Acre Farms (up 8 rupees to 45) and 100,000 Grain Elevators at 11.50, was 36.1 million rupees.
Gains outnumbered losses 31 to nine and prices for 19 stocks traded remained unchanged. Foreign sales amounted to 5.7 million rupees, but foreign buying was worth only 393,000 rupees.
Some of today's activity was generated by companies which are ending their financial year in December, booking short term gain to show profit, said another broker.
"Foreign buying was also there, but on fundamentally strong stock only," he said. --Mohan Samarasinghe (941) 434319
